# MTLDepthStencilState

**Protocol**

A depth and stencil state instance that specifies the depth and stencil configuration and operations used in a render pass.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol MTLDepthStencilState : NSObjectProtocol, Sendable
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDepthStencilState] protocol defines the interface for a lightweight instance used to encode how a graphics rendering pass should perform depth and stencil operations. The [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLRenderCommandEncoder] uses an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDepthStencilState] instance to set the depth and stencil state for a rendering pass.

The standard allocation and initialization techniques don’t apply when creating an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDepthStencilState] instance. Instead, you can apply the following steps:

1. Create an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDepthStencilDescriptor] instance that defines the operations you want the rendering pass to use.
2. Create an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDepthStencilState] instance by passing the descriptor to an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice] instance’s [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/makeDepthStencilState(descriptor:)] method.

Typically, you create [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDepthStencilState] instances when your app is first initialized and then reuse them throughout the lifetime of your app.

## Identifying properties

- **device**: The device from which this state object was created.
- **label**: A string that identifies this object.

## Instance Properties

- **gpuResourceID**

## Depth testing

- **Calculating primitive visibility using depth testing**: Determine which pixels are visible in a scene by using a depth texture.
- **MTLDepthStencilDescriptor**: An instance that configures new [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDepthStencilState] instances.
- **MTLStencilDescriptor**: An object that defines the front-facing or back-facing stencil operations of a depth and stencil state object.

- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
